    Zipline installation

    13 Jun 2019

    Windows

    Install Anaconda 3

    See the Anaconda Navigator Environments tab to see all the existing Python environment

    See the existing env conda info –envs

    Create a new environment with python 3.5.6 conda create -n py35_zipline python=3.5

    Activate the new evn source activate py35_zipline or Use Anaconda Navigator -> Environments then choose “Open Terminal” option

    Use conda to install Zipline (py35_zipline) conda install -c Quantopian zipline

    Now need to install cvxpy==1.0.3 by pip3 install cvxpy==1.0.3 Once you run the command you will get the Microsoft C++ build tool requirement error So need to install Build tool using Visual Studio 2019; install pretty much all of the option for the build tool to make it work.

    Then run the pip3 install cvxpy==1.0.3 Now you will get Link error such as LINK : fatal error LNK1158: cannot run ‘rc.exe’ error : command ‘C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\Bin\x86_amd64\link.exe’ failed with exit status 1158

    To solve the above problem, copy “C:\Program Files(x86)Windows Kits\10\bin\10.0.17763.0\x64\rc.exe and rcdll.dll” files and paste them into “C:\Program Files(x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\bin\x86_amd64” folder

    Then run the pip3 install cvxpy==1.0.3 again. It should work.

    MacBook(linux)

    Instead of install Microsoft Build tool use the following command

    yum install gcc-c++ then pip3 install cvxpy==1.0.3

    This project contains 5 pages and is available on GitHub. Copyright © , 2019.
